ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] CrawlURI - getOutLinks() returns an empty collection

X-Yahoo-Profile: poetbeware

Hi,

Check r4671 in the SVN log.  To make a long story short, it changed when 
the codebase started using Java 1.5 generics.

The old getOutLinks method would return either a list of CandidateURI 
objects, or a list of Link objects, depending on where you were in the 
processor chain.  In the new code, getOutLinks always returns a list of 
Link objects, and getOutCandidates always returns a list of CandidateURI 
objects.  getOutLinks isn't deprecated, but it will always be empty 
after extracted links are converted to CandidateURIs.

-Paul



Goel, Ankur wrote:
> 
> 
> Hi,
>        I recently migrated from Heritrix release 1.6.0 to 1.12.0.
> In one of the post processors that I have,  implemented
> I am using using
>  
> /        CrawlURI.getOutLinks()*  */
>  
> to get a collection of URI from the crawlURI, so that I can do
> some custom filtering operation.
>  
> It seems that the API always returns an empty collection.
>  
> I discovered the API
>  
>         CrawlURI.getOutCandidates()
>  
> and this seems to be returning the correct collection of Candidate URIs
> from a CrawlURI.
>  
> I want to know if this change was intentional in this release and if
>  
> /        CrawlURI.getOutLinks() /
> // 
> is deprecated since the API Javadocs did not say anything about this.
>  
> Also code pointers to where exactly the change was done would be
> very helpful.
>  
> Thanks
> -Ankur
>
